job description:
Engineering Technician

(R&D Engineering Technician)

A highly-skilled, experienced, electro-mechanical technician is required to support prototype component assembly, construction of test fixtures, system upgrades, system maintenance, test execution and data collection. Experience with, and an understanding of, complex, software-controlled, semiconductor-manufacturing capital equipment is required. This role will contribute directly to the successful development of new, large-area, precision photolithographic equipment. Experience operating and troubleshooting at the system level and diagnosing at the component level is required. A working understanding of software controls is essential.

Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with product engineers to support R&D engineering projects
  • Perform qualification testing, document test results, and write comprehensive reports to document performance of new sub-assemblies
  • Using engineering drawings and guidance from the lead engineer, assemble, test, and deliver operational test fixtures and prototype electro-mechanical assemblies
  • Install prototype assemblies on an existing systems for test and evaluation, ensuring that the assembly is properly installed and wired
  • Test, evaluate, troubleshoot and diagnose electronic and electro-mechanical issues at the system and component level
  • Develop proficiency in operating lithography equipment
  • Make measurements, perform tests, collect and tabulate data as required by the lead engineer
  • Meet assigned project schedules
  • Use various diagnostic equipment such as volt meters, oscilloscopes and precision mechanical measuring devices
  • Maintain rigorous lab notes and communicate findings clearly
  • May be required to travel to evaluate issues in the field, assist in escalations from product support or perform testing at customer sites as required
Required Skills and Experience:
  • Minimum of an associates or technical certificate in engineering
  • Minimum of 2 to 4 years of experience in assembly, integration and calibrations of semiconductor capital equipment, photolithography or equivalent equipment in a clean room.
  • Or, a minimum of 5 years of experience in the assembly, test, troubleshooting, and repair of complex electro-mechanical assemblies
  • Ability to follow clearly prepared instruction and provide the requested result (e.g., assembly installation or data collection)
  • Ability to read and understand (with some guidance and explanation) engineering drawings, interconnection diagrams, wiring schematics
  • Ability to troubleshoot simple electrical problems at the circuit board level
  • Ability to troubleshoot mechanical problems in components or on the larger system
  • Experience with, and an understanding of, complex, software-controlled, semiconductor-manufacturing capital equipment is required
  • Ability to troubleshoot electrical wiring and communications problems
  • Competence with basic math
  • Proficiency with MS Word and Excel
  • 3-d CAD experience, especially with Inventor is a plus
  • Available to travel to customer sites in Asia
Required Attributes:
  • Self-starter
  • Good communicator
  • Pro-active, quickly reports issues and concerns to the cognitive engineer or program management
  • Team player, able to work with others, comfortable asking for assistance or guidance
We are not currently accepting agency submissions for this position.

No relocation assistance is available for this position.
